intro: Collinia elatior, commonly known as the greater collinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. Collinia elatior is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
